Dear Mr. Sharpe:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment.
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is a concern that staff member who is no longer employed
was in contact with a youth that left the facility. Staff member was
counseled regarding their contact/relationship with youth while
they were both at the facility. The nature of their relationship while
at the CCI and after leaving is a concern.
Investigation A complaint was received on 5/17/23 alleging that Youth A, who
was released from the facility on 4/11/23, was in a relationship
with Staff 1. The complaint reported on 3/27/23 Staff 1 provided a
resignation date of 4/12/23 however she was let go prior to that
date. Staff 1 was spoken to several times about her interactions
with Youth A as she was spending more one-on-one time with him
than any other youth. Staff 1 discussed her personal life with
Youth A. The complaint went on to state that during Youth A’s stay
at the facility he received many letters from an unknown individual,
but they were believed to have been from Staff 1. Information in
the letters referred to things that were known about Staff 1. There
were no reports of inappropriate touching or a sexual relationship
while Youth A was at the facility.
2

Interviews
Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/18/23. She received information from Youth B's probation Officer
(PO) that Youth B told his mother a worker at the facility was
having an outside relationship with a youth at the facility. Prior to
this, there had been concerns about Staff 1's boundaries with
Youth A, but they did not have anything concrete. Complainant
knew it was Staff 1 and Youth A that Youth B was referring to
because there were no other issues with boundaries within the
facility. Complainant stated Staff 1 would be seen a lot with just
Youth A. They would be alone but out in the open folding laundry
or standing outside the lunchroom. Complainant stated Staff 1
should have been attending to the entire group not just one youth.
Complainant stated in their team meetings Staff 1 had been listed
as having boundary issues with Youth A.
The Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 5/18/23. He stated Staff 1 worked for the facility for a
year previously, but she worked as an intake worker rather than
working on the floor with the youth. Staff 1 resigned after a year to
go work for Michigan Department of Health and Human Services.
CA reported Staff 1 returned to the facility 9 months later on
9/14/2022 and worked on the floor with the youth. A supervisor
intercepted a letter to Youth A and it was brought to CA's attention
on 4/6/23. The letter that was found made him suspect it may
have been from Staff 1 given the content and the conversations
Staff 1 has had with other workers. CA had his staff search Youth
A's belongings for other letters. CA reported many letters were
found but none of them indicated who they were from or gave
specifics about the person. Staff 1 gave her resignation letter on
3/27/23 stating her last day would be 4/12/23. Due to CA's
suspicions, Staff 1's boundary issues, and her pending resignation
on 4/12/23 Staff 1 was asked not to return to the facility. Prior to
the letters being discovered, CA stated, there were several
complaints from staff about Staff 1's boundaries with Youth A. She
was coached and received additional trainings due to this but her
behaviors continued. Two different supervisors talked to Staff 1
about boundaries. She was told it did not look good to be
spending more time with one youth over the others. CA reported
Youth B told his mother that he was afraid a staff at the facility
would give Youth A, Youth B's address. Youth B's mother reported
this to Youth B's probation officer who then reported it to the
facility. CA stated due to the camera coverage it would be hard to
get a youth alone. There are not cameras in the bedrooms,
however staff are not allowed in the youth's bedrooms without
3

having another staff present. He stated the camera footage only
goes back 90 days. CA reported there is always someone
watching the cameras. Youth A was discharged on 4/11/23. CA
stated Youth A has been in and out of detention since he was 13
and is heavily involved in gangs. CA reported Staff 1 did not have
keys to the nurse’s station which remains locked unless the nurse
is working. There are also cameras leading to the nurse’s office so
Staff 1 would have been seen on camera if she went there with
Youth A.
During an on-site visit on 7/12/23 CA reported Staff 1 has been
trying to get in touch with Youth A since his return to the facility on
7/1/23. The facility has caller ID and her name was displayed 2
times trying to get ahold of Youth A. CA stated Youth A is very
manipulative. He was talked to about Staff 1 and denied any
relationship with her. When the letters were found in Youth A's cell
they did not have envelops with them. CA stated Youth A did not
get any outside mail sent to him. Someone had to physically give
him the letters. Youth A was re-admitted on 7/1/23. On 7/2 at
7:04am Staff 1 attempted to call him. The staff that answered the
phone saw it was her and would not let her talk to him. Youth E,
Youth A's girlfriend is also at the facility. Youth A turns 18 in
August. When Staff 1 was terminated Staff 1 did ask if she was in
trouble. When Staff 1 turned in her resignation letter she said she
was resigning due to family issues and moving out of state. There
was a rumor that Staff 1 took time off to go to Disney while she
worked at the facility. She did have time off during the time she
was rumored to have gone to Disney. The letters found in Youth
A's cell indicated the person writing them had gone to Disney.
When Youth A was admitted on 12/1/21 Staff 1 did the intake so
that was most likely their first communication. CA stated Staff 1
drove a black jeep.
Face to face at the facility on 7/24/23 CA reported Youth A and
Youth E do not have any contact with each other while at the
facility. They did confiscate letters, but the letters did not say
anything about Staff 1 they were discussing their plans for their
current charges.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/18/23. He
reported he is a supervisor. Staff 3 said Staff 1 was brought up in
a management meeting about her boundaries. They were to keep
an eye on her. She was seen with Youth A close together on the
wing. Staff 3 checked on the wing and he would see the two of
them alone on the wing. He stated this occurred even after Staff 1
was talked to about it. He said they were always out in the open
4

on the wing, in the gym, or in the canteen. Staff 1 was a floater so
she would go check on his wing and spend time with Youth A.
Staff 3 saw Staff 1 do this multiple times. He could not say
specifically when these incidents occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/18/23. He
stated Staff 1 was close with Youth A. He said he believed Staff 1,
who could access his personal information, would give his
address to Youth A. He knew Staff 1 and Youth A were close
because Staff 1 would always pull Youth A out of class. Youth B
stated he already had problems with Youth A. Youth B heard Staff
1 would take Youth A to the nurse’s station in order to have sex.
He thought they were having sex because when a peer brought it
up to Youth A, Youth A became upset. Staff 1 also brought a vape
in for Youth A. Youth B said she brought it in to him 2 weeks
before Youth A left. Youth B saw the vape while the boys were in
the bathroom and Youth A was on the counter dancing. While
Youth A was dancing the vape fell out of his pocket. Youth C was
also there for this. Youth C told Youth B that the "breeze" was
from Staff 1. Staff 1 quit working when Youth A left. Staff 1 also
brought Youth A edibles. Youth B heard about the edibles from
Youth D. Youth D told Youth B that Youth A shared the edibles
with Youth D. This was done to solve a beef with Youth D. Youth
B said he is no longer worried about Youth A. He said he told his
mom about Youth A getting his address just to scare her. Youth B
stated Youth A and Youth D were bullies. The youth at the facility
all knew Youth A could get their addresses from Staff 1.
Youth A's girlfriends’ grandfather was interviewed face to face at
his home on 5/19/23. He stated Youth A did not live with them and
that his granddaughter, Youth E, was not home. He reported
Youth A was with his granddaughter the previous day. The
grandfather contacted his granddaughter and she was put on
speaker phone so the DHHS Worker could talk to her. Youth E
stated she did not know where Youth A was nor did she have a
phone number for him. She stated she would contact him via
Facebook as his phone maybe off currently. She said she would
give Youth A the DHHS Worker's phone number.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/12/23
along with the DHHS Worker and local Law Enforcement (LE).
Youth E is Youth A's girlfriend and she remembered talking to us
on 5/19/23. She stated Youth A was with her when we called her
to find out where he was. Before we could ask Youth E any
questions she asked if we were there to talk to her about Staff 1.
She reported Staff 1 is her baby's daddy's ex-girlfriend. Staff 1
5

used to be a staff at the facility. She found out Youth A was
cheating on her with Staff 1, so she confronted Youth A and he
admitted it. Youth E had gone through Youth A's phone and saw a
number she did not recognize so she looked it up on Cash App.
Cash App tied to that number had a picture of Staff 1. She said
Staff 1 had texted Youth A that she missed him, and she could tell
other messages had been deleted. Youth E stated this happened
about a month or two ago. She called Staff 1 to confront her, and
Staff 1 admitted to being with Youth A previously but that they
were not currently together. Youth E reported she picked Youth A
up in her car and met with Staff 1 to get Youth A's clothes. This
happened at Youth A's parent’s house about 3-4 months ago. She
knew it was Staff 1 because Youth A told her it was. She never
actually saw Staff 1. Staff 1 stayed in her car which was a black
Jeep. Youth E stated she thought Youth A was staying with Staff
1. Youth E had picked Youth A up at an apartment in the town and
area Staff 1 lives in (per her employee record). Youth A said it was
his ex-girlfriend’s place. This occurred about 6-7 months ago or
maybe less. When Youth E talked to Staff 1 on the phone Staff 1
said she remembered that Youth E had been pregnant by Youth A
before. Youth E only talked to Staff 1 the one time. Youth E stated
she did not send Youth A any mail while he was at the facility
previously. Youth E did not know of any other youth who had a
relationship with Staff 1. Youth A told Youth E he started talking to
Staff 1 when he was at the facility previously and they had sex in
the nurse’s office. Youth E thought Youth A was using Staff 1 for a
place to stay. Youth A's mother was aware of Youth A and Staff
1's relationship as Youth A told Youth E his mom and Staff 1 were
friends. Youth E said her and Youth A started talking again about
6 months ago and they are good now. Youth A had told Youth E
that Staff 1 brought him vapes and weed pens. He never said
anything about edibles. Youth A did not say how he hid it or if he
shared it. She said the vape was probably a breeze because that
is what Youth A uses, but she did not know for sure.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/12/23
along with the DHHS Worker and LE. Youth C stated he has been
at the facility for 8 months. He did not want to answer any other
questions, so he was excused. LE met with him outside the
interview room. When they came back into the room LE stated
Youth C denied staff having a relationship with any youth or
bringing in edibles or vapes for any youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/12/23
along with the DHHS Worker and local LE. He reported he came
back to the facility on 7/1/23 and was here about 3 months ago.
6

Three months ago, he was at the facility for 7 months. He left on
4/11/23. Youth A said he stayed with his parents when he left on
4/11/23 and did not stay anywhere else. Youth A stated there was
not any staff that brought him, or any other youth vapes, edibles,
or pens that he is aware of. He stated he was not close to any of
the staff. Youth A remembered Staff 1 from the last time he was at
the facility. Staff 1 was chill and would talk to them when they
were upset. She would help them by talking to them. Staff 1 did
not have feelings for him that he knew of, and he did not have
feelings for her. The only touching allowed by staff is a touch on
the shoulder, a pat on the back, or a handshake. The only time
Staff 1 would have touched Youth A was a pat on the back when
he was upset or to get his attention. He would do activities with
her and about 3-4 times she would take him to the nurse’s office
whenever he would ask her to. It would take them a couple of
minutes and was always just the two of them. He stated there was
no sexual connection between him and Staff 1 in or out of the
facility. Youth A stated he received letters from other girlfriends
while he was at the facility, but he did not remember who they
were from. He received them through the mail. Youth A stated if
something did happen between him and Staff 1, he would not tell
us as he did not want to talk about his sex life.
At his request Youth A was interviewed again face to face at the
facility on 7/24/23 along with the DHHS Worker and local LE.
Youth A said he had talked to the complainant about the
allegations after we left the last time. He reported everything we
asked him about on 7/12/23 was true. He did have sex with Staff 1
at the facility. He stated the first time was around 12/17/22. The
two of them were talking about it while in the canteen (game
room). It was just the two of them talking, but other youth were in
the room. He would use the excuse of warming up water to go to
the nurse’s station. They then had sex by the refrigerator. They
were kissing at first and he said he wanted to have sex. He stated
they started to have a relationship in October of 2022, but did not
have sex until 12/17/22. He stated at first Staff 1 was scared to
have sex with him so after being in the nurse’s station they
returned to the canteen. They talked some more then went back
to the nurse’s station and had sex. He stated no one else was
around and it was in a location that could not be seen on camera.
Youth A stated Staff 1 used to work in intake so she knew where
the cameras could and could not see. He reported he and Staff 1
had sex at the facility 3-4 times. One time was in the intake
shower and the other times were in the nurse’s station. Youth A
clarified that they only had vaginal sex 2 times, one time oral, and
one time was just kissing. He reported Staff 1 said she loved
7

Youth A, but he did not feel the same. He said he just took what
he could get. The relationship continued until Youth A left the
facility. He stated Staff 1 resigned from the facility because he was
leaving. When he left the facility, he stayed with Staff 1 at her
place. Staff 1 picked him up at his parents’ house and took him to
her apartment where Staff 1 lives with her son. He reported Staff 1
picked him up in her black Jeep. He stayed at her place for about
a month. They continued their sexual relationship while he was
living with her. He then moved out because he was irritated by
her. She tried to control him. He stated he was with Youth E when
Staff 1 dropped off his clothes. Staff 1 had gotten upset when
Youth E picked Youth A up from her place. She would tell him that
she would move out of state with him. Youth A reported Staff 1
would bring in a wax pen, edibles and Breeze anytime he asked
for it. He asked her to bring in a phone, but she would not. He
reported she brought items in about 20 times. He would put the
items in his waist band and did not share them. Staff 1 did give
him the letters that were found in his cell. She would print them off
because the staff at the facility knew her handwriting. He stated
Staff 1 would mail them to him with no return address. Youth A
stated he changed his story because he knew she would just
protect herself. Youth A was able to describe Staff 1's private
piercings and tattoos. Youth A stated his girlfriend was aware of
his relationship with Staff 1.
The Nurse was questioned face to face at the facility on 7/12/23.
She reported Youth A wanted to get his weight often and to do
that they would need to come down to the nurse’s station. If she
was present, she would document the weight in his chart but if
they came when she was not present then she would not have
that documented. She never saw Youth A and Staff 1 by
themselves. She could not remember if Staff 1 ever brought Youth
A to the nurse’s station when she was present.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the local police station on
7/24/23. She was interviewed by the DHHS Worker, LE, and this
consultant. When Staff 1 came into the interview room she stated
she figured this was coming. She said it was alleged she was
"talking” to one of the youth at the detention center. The staff at
the detention center accused her of showing special treatment to
two youth at the facility. She indicated Youth A and Youth F. She
would pull them out of class because they had already graduated
so she would find something else for them to do. She would ask
the supervisor if she could take them to fold clothes or rearrange
the closet. Staff 1 said she was talked to by the supervisor about
showing favoritism and told her she is not a therapist so she
8

should not be acting like one. She told Youth A she got in trouble
for paying special attention to him and Youth A got upset about it.
He said she listens to him and helps him. Staff 1 said despite her
telling Youth A this he would still follow her. Youth F turned 18 and
left so after that it was just Youth A that she would pull out. She
would take him to the canteen or to the wing. She said some
supervisors said she could talk to Youth A and she would be
called to deal with him when he was acting up. Staff 1 said she did
not know why Youth A knew her phone number and where she
lived. All the youth at the facility know what kind of cars the staff
drive. Staff 1 was confronted about lying and she said she did
spend one on one time with Youth A and she did write him the
letters but the letters were written just to give him false hope. She
did not actually mean what she wrote. She was again confronted
for lying and stated she almost had sex with Youth A while at the
facility. She took him to check his weight and he grabbed her and
tried to have sex with her, but she stopped him because she was
scared of getting in trouble. She stated her pants were down at
the time. She denied anything else happened and nothing
happened in the intake shower. She said while at the facility they
only almost had sex once. She said this occurred in the nurse’s
station where she would take him to check his weight. Staff 1 said
Youth A would try to have sex with her at other times, but she
would pretend to call someone on the radio to get him to stop. She
said Youth A did stay with her for two nights when he got out.
They did have sex at her house. She was able to confirm the
piercings and tattoos Youth A described. She admitted she
brought an edible into the facility one time, and he ate it right
away. Staff 1 said she did talk to Youth E on the phone about
Youth A. Staff 1 said she did not have any calls or texts on her
phone from Youth A. She handed over her phone for LE to check.
Staff 1 stated Youth A's mom contacted her over messenger in
May or June to tell her about the investigation. Staff 1 said she
would occasionally call Youth A's mother in order to reach Youth
A. Staff 1 said the two of them were just messing around. They
were not boyfriend/girlfriend. Staff 1 denied calling up to the facility
to talk to Youth A. She thought it was someone posing as her.
Staff 1 said she has not talked to Youth A since April. Staff 1 was
again confronted about lying and she admitted she did have sex
with Youth A in the intake shower, but it was quick. She denied
giving Youth A oral sex. She did not have a relationship with any
other youth at the facility. She reported Youth A would ask for
everything. She only brought in an edible for him which he bit in
half, ate half, and put half in a napkin then in his waistband. Staff 1
said she would send Youth A money through Cash App. Staff 1
9

said she resigned from the facility because she did not like
working there.
A case conference occurred on 8/14/23 with the DHHS Worker
who reported she would have findings for sexual abuse and
improper supervision on Staff 1. The DHHS Worker reported LE
has charged Staff 1 with two counts of second degree criminal
sexual conduct.
Tour
A tour of the facility was conducted on 5/18/23 and 7/12/23. The
facility has many cameras in the hallways, day room, classrooms,
etc. Almost everything was either on camera or out in the open
and observable by people walking by or in adjacent rooms. The
only place Staff 1 could have gone without being in the open is the
hallway leading to the nurse’s office. This hallway is off limits to
youth unless they are with staff and going to see the nurse. The
main hallway has a camera. Once in the main hallway you need to
turn right off the hallway to an entry way that does not have a
camera. There is a refrigerator in this location. Then you have to
go left to a short hall that also is not in view of the camera then
right again to a longer hall that does have a camera. Off this hall is
an office, exam room, and storage rooms. There is a scale in this
hallway. At the time of the tour the nurse’s area past the first
hallway was unlocked and open with no one in attendance. The
intake shower is across the hall from the nurse’s station. There is
a camera in the intake shower room, but the room is divided by a
wall making half of the room not visible to the camera.
Documents Reviewed
• Staff 1 Employee File: Staff 1 was hired for a second time
on 9/16/22. She received training in professional
boundaries on 9/16/22 and had a Boundary Policy review
on 3/15/23. She did not have any official disciplines, but
she did have an evaluation dated 2/1/23 that stated she
needed to work on her boundaries. There was also a
Coachable Moment memo dated 4/9/23 by a facility
supervisor stating he spoke with Staff 1 in March of 2023
about her boundary issues with Youth A and told her it was
not appropriate for her to be spending so much time with
him. After this talk the supervisor wrote that he saw nothing
had changed with Staff 1 as she was back to spending a
noticeable amount of time with Youth A.
• Management Meeting Minutes from 10/26/22: When
discussing Staff 1 the notes state to watch her for gossip
tendencies and boundary issues with the youth.
10

• Management Meeting Minutes from 2/28/23: When
discussing Staff 1 the notes state she gossips and does not
seem happy. She is having conversations about leaving.
Watch her relations with Youth A.
• An e-mail from another supervisor dated 3/23/23 stated he
talked to Staff 1 about her boundaries.
• Resignation Letter from Staff 1: Dated 3/27/23 states her
resignation would be effective 4/12/23. It did not indicate a
reason for leaving.
• Letters found in Youth A's cell: There were 14 letters and
none of the letters have names or dates. The person writing
the letters talked about how much she loved the recipient of
the letters (Youth A), she talked about moving out of state
and her child, she talked about Youth A "coming home" to
her and them having a baby or two together. The letters
addressed Youth A changing his behavior and them
building a life together. One letter mentioned going to
Disney with her son.
• Unusual Incident Report: dated 6/29/23 indicating a call
came in from Staff 1's number but the person hung up. A
call came in from another number right afterwards and the
person sounded like a young white woman asking for Youth
A or Youth E.
• Log Book Entry: dated 7/2/23 stated Staff 1 attempted to
call asking for Youth A.
• On 7/13/23 an e-mail was received from CA indicating that
Youth A wanted to speak to us and he was stating the
allegations about Staff 1 were true.
• Professional Boundaries: Employee Relationships with
Residents policy: states personal, non-professional
relationships between staff and youth are prohibited. This
includes: any physical contact outside what is required to
maintain health and well-being, personal relationships,
disclosing personal information, buying or giving gifts, and
encouraging illegal behavior.
• DHHS Workers notes of her interview with Youth F: Youth
F denied anything inappropriate occurred between him and
Staff 1 and he also denied knowing anything about Staff 1
and Youth A or Staff 1 bringing in vape pens or edibles.
Analysis Staff 1 and Youth A both admitted to having a sexual relationship
while Youth A was placed at the facility. They also admitted that
Staff 1 brought in edibles for Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
